傾.definition: to overturn; to collapse; to lean; to tend; to incline; to pour out

傾倒.definition: to dump; to pour out; to empty out

傾側.definition: to lean to one side; slanting

傾危.definition: in danger of collapse; in a parlous state; (of person) treacherous

傾卸.definition: to tip; to dump by tipping from a vehicle

傾吐.definition: to pour out (emotions); to unburden oneself (of strong feelings); to vomit comprehensively

傾吐衷腸.definition: to pour out (emotions); to pour one's heart out; to say everything that is on one's mind

傾向於.definition: to incline to; to prefer; to be prone to

傾囊.definition: to empty out one's pocket; (fig.) to give everything one has (to help)

傾國傾城.definition: lit. capable of causing the downfall of a city or state (idiom); fig. (of a woman) devastatingly beautiful; also written 傾城傾國|倾城倾国[qing1 cheng2 qing1 guo2]

傾城.definition: coming from everywhere; from all over the place; gorgeous (of woman); to ruin and overturn the state

傾城傾國.definition: lit. capable of causing the downfall of a city or state (idiom); fig. (of a woman) devastatingly beautiful

傾家.definition: to ruin a family; to lose a fortune

傾巢.definition: lit. the whole nest came out (to fight us); a turnout in full force (of a gang of villains)

傾巢來犯.definition: to turn out in force ready to attack (idiom)

傾巢而出.definition: the whole nest came out (idiom); to turn out in full strength

傾心.definition: to admire wholeheartedly; to fall in love with

傾斜.definition: to incline; to lean; to slant; to slope; to tilt

傾斜度.definition: inclination (from the horizontal or vertical); slope; obliquity

傾泄.definition: to cascade down; to flow in torrents; (fig.) outpouring (of emotions)

傾盆大雨.definition: a downpour; rain bucketing down; (fig.) to be overwhelmed (with work or things to study)

傾盡.definition: to do all one can; to give all one has

傾箱倒篋.definition: (idiom) to exhaust all one has; to leave no stone unturned; to try one's best

傾翻.definition: to overturn; to topple; to tip

傾耳.definition: to prick up one's ear; to listen attentively

傾耳細聽.definition: to prick up one's ear and listen carefully

傾蓋.definition: to meet in passing; to get on well at first meeting

傾覆.definition: to capsize; to collapse; to overturn; to overthrow; to undermine

傾角.definition: dip; angle of dip (inclination of a geological plane down from horizontal); tilt (inclination of ship from vertical)

傾訴.definition: to say everything (that is on one's mind)

傾陷.definition: to frame (an innocent person); to collapse

傾頹.definition: to collapse; to topple; to capsize
